cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles SE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north on Tuesday, then north-northeast, becoming a major hurricane over the east-central Gulf, making first landfall along Florida’s west coast Wednesday night–Thursday, then moving inland across the Southeast toward the Carolinas by Friday–Saturday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast (around the Tampa Bay–Cedar Key region)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Altamaha Sound GA to Flagler/Volusia County Line FL (Storm-Surge Watch), Suwannee River FL to Indian Pass FL and Jupiter Inlet FL to Altamaha Sound GA (Tropical-Storm Watch).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cuban provinces of Isla de Juventud, Pinar del Rio, Artemisa; Englewood FL to Anclote River FL including Tampa Bay (Hurricane Warning); Dry Tortugas FL (Hurricane Warning); Anclote River southward to Flamingo FL including Tampa Bay (Storm-Surge Warning).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire eastern Gulf Coast of FL, then the Georgia and South Carolina coasts, with the cone extending into coastal North Carolina including Cape Fear region.
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (rainfall bands could approach or exceed 4 inches late week)
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤8% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds, breezy conditions possible Friday–Saturday)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected above minor tidal departures; primary surge focus remains south of Cape Fear.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Friday-Saturday as remnant core tracks toward the Carolinas; localized flooding possible.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and rip currents late week; small risk of brief tornadoes in outer rain-bands.
